alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 6:12PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central DeKalb County through 700 PM CDT... At 610 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Little River Falls to near Fort Payne. Movement was slowly north at 5 mph. Heavy rainfall may cause nuisance flooding in and around Fort Payne shortly. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Payne, Rainsville, Henagar, Sylvania, Valley Head, Hammondville, Mentone, Pine Ridge, Guest and Adamsburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
